head.title: How to Extract Images from Excel, Word, PDF & Other Documents via {{ProductName}}?
head.description: {{ProductFullName}} API allows software developers to parse & extract images from PDF, DOC, DOCX, PPT, PPTX, XLS, XLSX documents & Emails inside {{ProductName}} Apps.

header.title: {{ProductName}} API to Parse & Extract Images from Excel, Word, PowerPoint, PDF & Other Document's Pages
header.description: {{ProductFullName}} API allows programmers to extract images from PDF, DOC, DOCX, PPT, PPTX, EML, MSG, XLS, XLSX, CSV, ODT, RTF & EPUB documents or document’s Pages inside {{ProductName}} applications.

about.title: Learn How to Extract Images from {{EXT}} Documents or a Specific Page via {{ProductName}} API
about.h1: An Image is worth a thousand words and cannot be ignored in today’s visual world while creating engaging content. Images can be a great source of information communication as well as grabbing user’s attention. It is often needed to get images from documents, journals or presentations and use them somewhere else. {{ProductFullName}} is a powerful API that helps software developers and programmers to build solution for parsing and extracting images  or other information from numerous  documents types.  It also support saving images in PNG, JPEG, WebP, GIF, BMP and other formats. The API has included support for some popular documents formats, such as PDF, Microsoft Office formats: Word (DOC, DOCX), PowerPoint (PPT, PPTX), Excel (XLS, XLSX), LibreOffice formats, Emails, Ebooks, and many more.  It has also included support for some advanced features related to documents parsing, extracting plain and structured text, text searching by keywords, extract metadata or images, containers as well as attachments and many more.

content_left.description: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{slash_lang}}/parser/{{ProductCode}}/) makes it easy for {{ProgLang}} developers to extract images from a {{EXT}} file by implementing a few easy steps.
content_left.step_1: Instantiate [Parser](https://reference.groupdocs.com/java/parser/com.groupdocs.parser/Parser) object for the initial document;
content_left.step_2: Call [getImages](https://reference.groupdocs.com/parser/java/com.groupdocs.parser/parser/#getImages--) method and obtain collection of image objects;
content_left.step_3: Check if reader isn’t *null* (images extraction is supported for the document);
content_left.step_4: Iterate through the collection and get sizes, image types and image contents.
